summary: This document is a financial statement from Deutsche Bank detailing the account balances and transactions for Jeffrey Epstein's account as of April 30, 2017. It includes information on deposits, withdrawals, service charges, and ending balances, highlighting significant outgoing transfers to various entities.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein is the primary account holder at Deutsche Bank, with detailed transactions and balances listed in the document.

persons.name: Stewart Oldfield
persons.context: Stewart Oldfield is mentioned as a contact for personal assistance regarding the account.

persons.name: Lee McKenzie
persons.context: Lee McKenzie is referenced as a recipient of a payment from Epstein's account.

connections.description: Lee McKenzie received a payment from Jeffrey Epstein's account.

events.title: Outgoing Transfer to Wells Fargo
events.description: A transfer of $2,520.00 was made from Epstein's account to Wells Fargo Bank.

events.title: Outgoing Transfer to Lee McKenzie Consultants
events.description: A transfer of $166,666.67 was made from Epstein's account to Lee McKenzie Consultants, LLC.

locations: 6100 Red Hook Quarter, St. Thomas, USVI 00802
keyFacts: The document details Jeffrey Epstein's account balance as of April 30, 2017, which was $345,806.60.
There were significant outgoing transfers from Epstein's account, including $2,520.00 to Wells Fargo and $166,666.67 to Lee McKenzie Consultants, LLC.
Service charges and fees totaling $50.00 were noted for the statement period.
The document includes instructions for reporting errors or issues with the account statement.
